intro: Pfaffia sericea var. vestita, commonly known as the velvet leaf arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its velvety, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, spadix-like flowers surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural collections.
